alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Anson; Chatham; Guilford; Montgomery; Moore; Orange; Randolph; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A line of showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of Alamance, western Moore, Orange, central Anson, Montgomery, northwestern Richmond, Randolph, southeastern Stanly, eastern Guilford and western Chatham Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers with isolated thunderstorms extending from near Troy to Asheboro to Greensboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. The isolated thunderstorms were located 7 miles northeast of Asheboro and near Mount Gilead. An occasional lightning strike is a hazard with these storms. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 25 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Burlington, Asheboro, Graham, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Randleman, Troy, Siler City and North Carolina Zoo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this line. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Alamance; Anson; Chatham; Guilford; Montgomery; Moore; Orange; Randolph; Richmond; Stanly
